Title: Is Your Code Generated by ChatGPT Really Correct? Rigorous Evaluation of Large Language Models for Code Generation
Authors: Jiawei Liu, Chunqiu Steven Xia, Yuyao Wang, Lingming Zhang
Summary: Program synthesis has been long studied with recent approaches focused on directly using the power of Large Language Models (LLMs) to generate code. Programming benchmarks, with curated synthesis problems and test-cases, are used to measure the performance of various LLMs on code synthesis. However, these test-cases can be limited in both quantity and quality for fully assessing the functional correctness of the generated code. Such limitation in the existing benchmarks begs the following question: In the era of LLMs, is the code generated really correct? To answer this, we propose EvalPlus -- a code synthesis benchmarking framework to rigorously evaluate the functional correctness of LLM-synthesized code. EvalPlus augments a given evaluation dataset with large amounts of test-cases newly produced by an automatic test input generator, powered by both LLM- and mutation-based strategies. While EvalPlus is general, we extend the test-cases of the popular HUMANEVAL benchmark by 81x to build HUMANEVAL+. Our extensive evaluation across 19 popular LLMs (e.g., GPT-4 and ChatGPT) demonstrates that HUMANEVAL+ is able to catch significant amounts of previously undetected wrong code synthesized by LLMs, reducing the pass@k by 13.6-15.3% on average. Our work not only indicates that prior popular code synthesis evaluation results do not accurately reflect the true performance of LLMs for code synthesis, but also opens up a new direction to improve such programming benchmarks through automated testing.

main_contribution.headline: EvalPlus: A rigorous evaluation framework for LLM-synthesized code
main_contribution.description: The paper introduces EvalPlus, a code synthesis benchmarking framework designed to rigorously evaluate the functional correctness of code generated by Large Language Models (LLMs). EvalPlus enhances a given evaluation dataset by adding a large number of test-cases produced by an automatic test input generator, which uses both LLM- and mutation-based strategies. The authors also extend the popular HUMANEVAL benchmark by 81x to create HUMANEVAL+, which is used to evaluate 19 popular LLMs. The results indicate that existing code synthesis evaluation results may not accurately reflect the true performance of LLMs.

takeaways.headline: EvalPlus provides a more rigorous evaluation of LLM-generated code
takeaways.description: EvalPlus offers a more comprehensive and rigorous evaluation of LLM-generated code, which can be crucial for LLM practitioners aiming to use these models for code synthesis. By augmenting existing benchmarks with a large number of test-cases, EvalPlus can catch significant amounts of previously undetected incorrect code. This can help practitioners better understand the limitations of LLMs in code synthesis and work towards improving their performance.
takeaways.example: For instance, an LLM practitioner can use EvalPlus to evaluate the code generated by their model. If the model fails a significant number of test-cases, the practitioner can then investigate the reasons for these failures and make necessary adjustments to improve the model's performance.

novelty_analysis: The introduction of EvalPlus represents a significant advancement in the evaluation of LLM-generated code. By augmenting existing benchmarks with a large number of test-cases, it provides a more rigorous and comprehensive evaluation than previous methods.
technical_analysis: The paper is somewhat technical, as it delves into the details of how EvalPlus works and how it is used to evaluate LLM-generated code. However, it does not require advanced mathematical knowledge and can be understood by someone with a computer science background.
enjoyable_analysis: The paper is well-written and organized, presenting a novel and intriguing contribution to the field. It provides practical insights that are useful for LLM practitioners, making it an enjoyable read.
